org.jerkar.api.file
Class JkPath

java.lang.Object
  org.jerkar.api.file.JkPath
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<java.io.File>
public final class JkPath
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<java.io.File>

A sequence of file (folder or archive) to be used as a path.
Each file is called an entry.
Instances of this class are immutable.

Method Summary

assertAllEntriesExist

public JkPath assertAllEntriesExist()
                             throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
Throws an IllegalStateException if at least one entry does not exist.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException

withoutDoubloons

public JkPath withoutDoubloons()
Returns a JkPath identical to this one but without redundant files. So if a given file in the sequence exist twice or more, then only the first occurrence is kept.

entries

public java.util.List<java.io.File> entries()
Returns the sequence of files as a list.
